title: Elf (monster)
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For other uses of the word elf, see [Elf](/Elf "Elf").*

|   | An elf, a member of an ancient fey race. Elves are slightly built when compared to humans, and have an innate magical acumen, though less than their deep elf cousins. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
  - [1.1 Variant Elves](#Variant_Elves)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Plain **elves** are fairly boring humanoid monsters, only posing a threat if they happen to find a decent weapon before you encounter them. However, they are only ever found in a handful of rare [vaults](/Vault "Vault"). If you see an elf elsewhere, it's most likely a [shapeshifter](/Shapeshifter_\(monster\) "Shapeshifter (monster)"). Elf zombies can be found inside and around an [Ossuary](/Ossuary "Ossuary").

### Variant Elves

[![Deformed elf.png](/images/c/c7/Deformed_elf.png)](/File:Deformed_elf.png)You can find **deformed elves**, **febrile elves**, and **sickly elves** in some of the sealed chambers in [Cigotuvi's Fleshworks](/Cigotuvi%27s_Fleshworks "Cigotuvi's Fleshworks").

|   |                                              |
| - | -------------------------------------------- |
|   | This poor creature looks hideously deformed. |

## Tips & Tricks

- The [uniques](/Unique "Unique") [Dowan](/Dowan "Dowan"), [Duvessa](/Duvessa "Duvessa"), and [Fannar](/Fannar "Fannar") are listed simply as "elf" for their species.

## History

- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), you could find **grey elves**, who had the same stats, in some vaults.
html:
Elf (monster)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For other uses of the word elf, see Elf.

elf e 
HP 23-48
HD 8
XP 348
Speed 10
AC 3
EV 15
Will 40
Attack1 10 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type elf, elf
Flags Speaks
Warm-blooded
No poly
An elf, a member of an ancient fey race. Elves are slightly built when compared to humans, and have an innate magical acumen, though less than their deep elf cousins.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
    • 1.1 Variant Elves
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 History

Useful Info

Plain elves are fairly boring humanoid monsters, only posing a threat if they happen to find a decent weapon before you encounter them. However, they are only ever found in a handful of rare vaults. If you see an elf elsewhere, it's most likely a shapeshifter. Elf zombies can be found inside and around an Ossuary.

Variant Elves

You can find deformed elves, febrile elves, and sickly elves in some of the sealed chambers in Cigotuvi's Fleshworks.

This poor creature looks hideously deformed.

Tips & Tricks

  • The uniques Dowan, Duvessa, and Fannar are listed simply as "elf" for their species.

History

  • Prior to 0.13, you could find grey elves, who had the same stats, in some vaults.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Elf_(monster)&oldid=72181"

rawPage:
{{version028}}
''For other uses of the word elf, see [[Elf]].''
{{monster info|elf}}

==Useful Info==
Plain '''elves''' are fairly boring humanoid monsters, only posing a threat if they happen to find a decent weapon before you encounter them. However, they are only ever found in a handful of rare [[vault]]s. If you see an elf elsewhere, it's most likely a [[shapeshifter (monster)|shapeshifter]]. Elf zombies can be found inside and around an [[Ossuary]].

===Variant Elves===
[[File:Deformed elf.png]]You can find '''deformed elves''', '''febrile elves''', and '''sickly elves''' in some of the sealed chambers in [[Cigotuvi's Fleshworks]].

{{Flavour|This poor creature looks hideously deformed.}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*The [[unique]]s [[Dowan]], [[Duvessa]], and [[Fannar]] are listed simply as "elf" for their species.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.13]], you could find '''grey elves''', who had the same stats, in some vaults.
